result.execSummary:
The defendant William Howard Clark III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Howard Clark III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Howard Clark III was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Probation is concurrent to current probation without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Court reserves on days credit against ultimate sentence.
- Jail staff to assist Defendant with signing up for probation.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $243 Court Costs. Payable through probation on Count 3 in St. Croix County Case 22CF41.
- $200 DNA Surcharge. Payable through probation on Count 3 in St. Croix County Case 22CF41.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through.

01:13 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF: William Howard Clark appeared from jail.  Includes 21CF950, 21CM461, & 2CF41.  Court reviews files, motions and letters filed by Atty Dolfi and DE regarding counsel.  Court questions DE.  Ct finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives counsel and is competent to represent himself.  Court appoints Atty Dolfi as a standby attorney. Court denies Motion to dismiss filed by DE.  ADA Smestad recites offer for these cases so DE understands what he can plead to if he chooses to do so.  Off Record discussions at 1:28 PM.  Back on at 1:32 PM, appearances as previously noted.  ADA Smestad states there is an agreement, recites joint agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads G to Ct 1- AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct- Statue 947.01 in 21CF950. DE pleads G to Ct 3- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 22CF41. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of AMENDED Ct 1 in 21CF950 & Ct 3 in 22CF41. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 21CF950, Ct 1 & 2 in 22CF41.  Court reads in and dismisses Ct 1 for purposes of restitution and dismisses Ct 2 in 21CM461.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:  Ct 1 in 21CF950. 

S/W 1 Year Probation 
Probation is concurrent to current probation without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.

- Court Costs: $243.00  Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
- Restitution: $12.65- Kwik Trip

- AODA and follow through 
- Absolute sobriety
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through
- Pay supervision fees
- Jail staff to help DE sign up for probation

- Court reserves on credit for time served.

11:03 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA:  Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF: William Howard Clark appeared. William Howard Clark appeared by video means in jail.  Includes 21CF950 (PH), 21CM461 (PTC), and 22CF41 (PH).  Court addresses the reason DE is appearing via zoom.  Off record discussions.  Back on record at 11:06 AM, appearances same as noted before.  Court reviews files.  Atty. Dolfi states DE is willing to appear by zoom for these hearings. Court questions DE and accepts DE's waiver of right to be here in person.  Court will allow this matter to proceed by zoom.  ADA Brekken states an amended complaint will be filed on 21CF950 amending to misdimeanor and would like to continue with PH on 22CF41.  S/T of Patrol Srgt. Bradley Kusmirek of Hudson PD.  Direct by ADA Brekken.  Court will take Judicial notice for purposes of PH of bond in 20CF685.  Cross by Atty. Dolfi. Re-direct by ADA Brekken.  Re-cross by Atty. Dolfi.  In 22CF41 Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Adjourned at 11:24 AM. bph  Arraignment scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
